geninfo.para: Rubber streaking of vibration damper and replacement criteria.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para:
A condition called 'rubber streaking' is commonly observed on the vibration damper, refer to Vibration Damper Rubber Streaking
.

Rubber streaking becomes evident as the rubber, found between the inertia ring and damper pulley, begins its normal life cycle process, refer to the Cutaway View Of Vibration Damper Rubber Compound And Inertia Ring
. This process occurs due to high temperatures generated from the energy absorbed by the damper over a period of time. The time required to generate this condition varies greatly between engine rating and vehicle application.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Cutaway View Of Vibration Damper Rubber Compound And Inertia Ring

svcproc.para:
The streaking condition described, occurs on both the front and rear surfaces of the vibration damper. A vibration damper with rubber streaking SHOULD NOT be replaced immediately and can remain in operation for some time. Due to the confusion of when to replace the vibration damper, the following is recommended. Replace the vibration damper when the rubber has recessed more than; 10 mm (3/8 inch) in depth across a 51 mm (2 inch) radius of the rubber compound on both sides of the vibration damper or if rubber member 'chunking' occurs (refer to Vibration Damper Replacement Condition
).

In Vibration Damper Replacement Condition
, the damper on the left needs to be replaced while the damper on the right is still in good working condition.

important.para: NOTICE THE DEPTH OF THE GROOVE BETWEEN THE VIBRATION DAMPER PULLEY AND INERTIA RING. THE GROOVE IS MUCH DEEPER AND LONGER IN LENGTH ON THE DAMPER WHICH NEEDS TO BE REPLACED.

note.para: A copy of this service bulletin should be filed with the engine service manual (Form No. EGES 105 or EGES 160) until the manual has been updated to include this change.
